SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

net.xeoh.plugins.base.annotations.injections
Annotation Type InjectPlugin

@Target(value={FIELD,METHOD})
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface InjectPlugin

Inject some instance implementing the given plugin interface. If the plugin is not available at spawntime (and the dependency is marked as optional), null will be inserted. If the plugin was not marked as optional this plugin will not be spawned. For example, to specify that the PluginManager should be injected into the plugin, you would write:

@InjectPlugin
public PluginManager pluginManager;

Another example. To specify that a language service for Swahili should be injected in case it is there and null in case it is not, you could write:

@InjectPlugin(requiredCapabilities = {"language:swahili"}, isOptional=true)
public LanguageService service;

This ensures that the returned plugin, if it is there, is of type LanguageService and has the capability (see Capabilities) of processing Swahili. If isOptional is false or omitted then it is even ensured that this plugin will not be spawned unless the given service is available.

Please note: The annotated variable has to be public!

Author:
Ralf Biedert
See Also:
PluginManager

Optional Element Summary
 boolean isOptional
          If set to true, the PluginManager may instanciate the plugin anyway, even if the other plugin is not present yet.
 java.lang.String[] requiredCapabilities
          All the capabilities the plugins must have in order to be instanciated
 

requiredCapabilities

public abstract java.lang.String[] requiredCapabilities
All the capabilities the plugins must have in order to be instanciated

Returns:
Number of classes that the plugin explicitly depends on.
Default:
{}

isOptional

public abstract boolean isOptional
If set to true, the PluginManager may instanciate the plugin anyway, even if the other plugin is not present yet.

Returns:
.
Default:
false
